summary: This is an email chain from September 2019 between federal prosecutors, discussing coordination with New Mexico state authorities regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Ranch property. It references the New Mexico State Land Commissioner revoking Epstein's grazing leases and the state Attorney General's criminal investigation.

persons.name: Stephanie Garcia Richard
persons.context: Quoted in a news article for revoking the grazing leases held by Epstein's company, Cypress Inc., on state trust land at Zorro Ranch.

persons.name: Hector Balderas
persons.context: Quoted in a news article stating his office is conducting a state-level criminal investigation regarding the Zorro Ranch property, in coordination with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose New Mexico property (Zorro Ranch) and conduct are under investigation by both state and federal authorities.

connections.person2: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
connections.description: Balderas states his state-level investigation is being conducted 'in coordination with' the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office.
Garcia Richard's office notified Balderas's office about potential criminal activity on the leased land to support lease cancellation.
As State Land Commissioner, Garcia Richard revoked the state grazing leases held by Epstein's company, Cypress Inc.
Balderas, as State Attorney General, is conducting a criminal investigation into whether crimes occurred on Epstein's Zorro Ranch property.

events.title: NM Land Commissioner Revokes Epstein Leases
events.description: New Mexico State Land Commissioner Stephanie Garcia Richard voided the grazing leases held by Epstein's Cypress Inc. on state trust land at Zorro Ranch.

events.title: Scheduled Follow-up Call
events.description: A follow-up call is scheduled between federal prosecutors to discuss Epstein's New Mexico conduct and property.

keyFacts: New Mexico State Land Commissioner Stephanie Garcia Richard revoked the state grazing leases held by Jeffrey Epstein's company, Cypress Inc., for the Zorro Ranch property.

New Mexico Attorney General Hector Balderas confirmed his office is conducting a state-level criminal investigation into whether crimes occurred at Zorro Ranch, and is coordinating this investigation with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email chain shows active coordination and scheduling of calls between federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein investigation in New Mexico in September 2019.
The revocation of the leases was sought by state authorities partly to find a legal reason to cancel them, with criminal activity being cited as a 'perfect reason'.
Revenue from the state trust land in question benefits New Mexico public schools.
